section.title: Overview
section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (the importer), to prepare Purchase Orders and subsequently group them to initiate Import Letters of Credit.
In this chapter, we use the terms importer and buyer interchangeably, and terms exporter and seller interchangeably,

section.title: POs and LCs
section.para: The module provides facilities for creating and updating POs and communicating with the exporter and/or bank about them. It is similar to many other modules in , which provide similar facilities for other products such as Letters of Credit.
In addition, the module provides functions for creating a Letter of Credit from a group of POs. This process is called registering the POs.

section.title: Bank Involvement
section.para: The bank associated with these transactions is known as the Issuing Bank, just as in other modules, even though in this case it does not really issue anything. In this module the bank is more of an observer, since no bank approval is needed for POs and invoices to pass between buyer and seller.

If both the buyer and the seller are users of , the POs and invoices pass directly between them, and are sent to the Issuing Bank for information only, enabling the bank to offer services such as financing.

If only one of the companies is a user of , then communications between them are sent via the Issuing Bank. While one company uses to communicate with the bank, the other must use some other channel such as SWIFT TSU.

section.title: Counterparty Access
section.para: If your counterparty (the seller) is not an existing user of , your company can give them limited access to to enable them to receive your POs and send you invoices. They do this using the and modules, which are described in the chapters Purchase Order Advice Module and Invoice Module.
This module is sometimes called the Purchase Order Apply module to distinguish it from the module.

section.title: Submit Function
section.para: In most modules in , the Submit function sends the product (for example, Letter of Credit request) you have created to its intended recipient (in most cases, the Issuing Bank). In the module, the Submit function merely saves the PO ready to be registered to a Letter of Credit.
Registering the PO to an Letter of Credit is the end of the life cycle of the PO. You can subsequently Submit the LC.

section.title: Functions
section.para: In this module you can do the following:

listitem.para: Enter the desired terms of a new Purchase Order and validate these details, or upload a file containing details of several Purchase Orders.
Group the prepared Purchase Orders in order to initiate one or more Letters of Credit.

Display a list of all Purchase Orders that are still pending, which means POs that have been initiated but not yet internally approved. You can open them from this page to update their current content or state.
Browse through all your company's existing Purchase Orders to review their details or history, and optionally print a hard copy of their transaction data.
Delete Purchase Orders, to clean up your workspace of outdated, incomplete or unused/unregistered transactions.
Define the sections to be included in the PO Initiation form, and the formats available for the files you will upload in the Upload function.

section.title: Initiate
section.para: This section describes the PO Initiation function and the forms it uses.

section.title: PO Initiation Options
section.para: This action has several sub-menu items, providing different ways to create a Purchase Order, or to create a template to be used in creating Purchase Orders.

section.title: From Scratch
section.para: Create a Purchase Order or PO template from a blank form.
When you select this option, you are presented with the blank form.

section.title: From Template
section.para: Create a Purchase Order or PO template from a template that you have previously created.
Most of the information for the transaction is defaulted except data such as the expiry date, currency and amount of the new PO.

section.title: Copy From Order
section.para: Create a Purchase Order or PO template from an existing PO. Used in a similar way to From Template.

section.title: Upload Orders
section.para: Create one or more Purchase Orders by uploading a file.

You can use this feature to provide the details in an attached file instead of creating each PO by filling in the long online form used in the From Scratch option. Typically this file will have been extracted from your internal system, and will contain details of one or more POs.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of your company's existing POs. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Entity/Buyer Name, Seller Name, and/or Ccy fields at the top of the page.
The data in the file consists of Line Items, detailing the individual lines of goods to be ordered.
You select the file format from a list of formats defined beforehand using the Parameters > Upload function. You can also select a PO template containing details to add to the details from the file.

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: Complete a Purchase Order that you or another user have already started and saved.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of POs that have been prepared and saved by users in your company (the buyer), but have not yet been completed or have not been successfully submitted because the input user had insufficient authorisation.
You can search the list by entering search criteria in the System Id, Seller Name, Currency and/or User Name fields at the top of the page.
The columns show the System Id, Purchase Order reference, Seller Name, Currency, Amount, User Name (of the user who created the draft) and Input date of each PO.
Click in the System Id column to open the draft for further editing.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Complete a Purchase Order that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of POs that have been prepared and saved by users in your company (the buyer), but have not been successfully submitted because the user had insufficient authorisation. (Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.)
You can search the list by entering search criteria. The criteria you can enter are the same as for the Edit Transactions option, and the list contains the same columns.
Click in the System Id column to open the PO in a non-editable mode, so you can review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of items that have been successfully sent to the Issuing Bank, next to the list of the records pending from an additional validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
